competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Biggest rival to Cisco, competed in almost every technology area with widest product overlap

competitors.name: Alcatel-Lucent
competitors.notes: Major domestic competitor alongside Juniper in network infrastructure

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Overseas competitor offering full networking solutions for enterprise businesses

competitors.name: Check Point
competitors.notes: Pioneer in cybersecurity established 1993, first company to introduce stateful inspection firewall

competitors.name: HPE Aruba
competitors.notes: Offered wireless solutions, AI-based NaaS, SDWAN, cloud and WAN storage/routing

competitors.name: Arista Networks
competitors.notes: Focused on high-end, high-performance networking devices

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Focused on networking solutions including wired/wireless networks, SD-WAN

context: By 2005, Cisco continued to be challenged by both domestic competitors and overseas competitor Huawei. Cisco acquired Airespace for $450 million in January 2005.
